channel.description: Lee Sanderson is a software engineer and advocate of software craftsmanship. He blogs about may topics including craftsmanship, .NET and Azure
channel.title: SixSidedDice Blog

item.author: lee@sixsideddice.com
item.description: A review of the classic DevOps lifecycle and a proposal for a cleaner model
item.title: DevOps Lifecycle

item.author: lee@sixsideddice.com
item.description: Exploring the Agentic capabilities of GitHub Copilot by building a simple side-scrolling game
item.title: Evaluating Agents By Building Games

item.author: lee@sixsideddice.com
item.description: Debate remains on the effectiveness of AI based coding assistants. This article examines the limitations of these tools and assesses the impact on productivity and software maintainability. Through practical experiments and analysis, I explore whether these tools truly enhance development or introduce new challenges that require careful oversight.
item.title: How Useful Are Coding Assistants in 2025?

item.author: lee@sixsideddice.com
item.description: An overview of the two main styles of TDD
item.title: Styles of Test Driven Development

item.author: lee@sixsideddice.com
item.description: Missing data is a common challenge in data engineering. In this post I examine the different types of missing data and the impact they have on data engineering. We will discuss practical strategies for identifying and handling missing data with real-world examples.
item.title: Data Engineering Basics: Dealing With Missing Data

item.author: lee@sixsideddice.com
item.description: Part 1 of my series of developer guides on understanding and applying data science. This part focuses on the foundational skills and knowledge I believe every developer needs to get started with data science.
item.title: Data Science for Developers: Part 1 - Foundations

item.author: lee@sixsideddice.com
item.description: Part 2 of my series of developer guides on understanding and applying data science. This part focuses on the fundamental and the core concepts of machine learning, providing developers with a comprehensive introduction to the field.
item.title: Data Science for Developers: Part 2 - Fundamentals

item.author: lee@sixsideddice.com
item.description: A guide to creating and deploying packages to NuGet.org
item.title: Creating Packages For NuGet.org

item.author: lee@sixsideddice.com
item.description: Instructions to help you set up minikube on a Windows 10 Home edition
item.title: Setting up minikube on Windows 10

item.author: lee@sixsideddice.com
item.description: A list of useful minikube commands
item.title: Useful minikube commands

item.author: lee@sixsideddice.com
item.description: An introduction to getting started using GitHub and Markdown for blogging
item.title: Blogging with GitHub and Markdown

item.author: lee@sixsideddice.com
item.description: Leveraging Obsidian to increase the quality and quantity of your blog articles
item.title: Blogging With Obsidian

item.author: lee@sixsideddice.com
item.description: Publishing content to GitHub Pages using Azure DevOps pipelines
item.title: Deploying to GitHub Pages

item.author: lee@sixsideddice.com
item.description: How to build a static website from a bunch of Markdown documents using C#, Markdig, and RazorEngine.NetCore
item.title: Generating a Static Website Using Markdown

item.author: lee@sixsideddice.com
item.description: How to maintain a personal knowledge base with Obsidian
item.title: Knowledge Management With Obsidian

item.author: lee@sixsideddice.com
item.description: Introduction to decision trees and examples showing how SciKit Learn can be used to solve classification type problems by trying to predict survivors of the Titanic.
item.title: Decision Tree Classifiers By Example

item.author: lee@sixsideddice.com
item.description: An introduction to Scikit-Learn’s Random Forest Classifiers, covering how they reduce overfitting and sensitivity to noise compared to decision trees, how feature importance reveals which inputs most influence predictions, and why handling missing data is often less critical.
item.title: Random Forest Classifiers By Example

item.author: lee@sixsideddice.com
item.description: As AI coding agents automate simpler tasks, the traditional apprenticeship model that nurtures junior developers is at risk. This article explores the long-term implications for engineering teams and argues that preserving pathways for junior talent is essential to sustain software development as a craft.
item.title: AI and The Death of The Junior Developer

item.author: lee@sixsideddice.com
item.description: Vibe coding tools promise to make software development faster and easier, but history tells a cautionary tale. Like 4GLs and Model-Driven Architecture before them, these tools risk repeating the cycle of hype, complexity, and disillusionment. Real engineering practices and not just "vibes" remain essential for building systems that last.
item.title: Vibe Coding: The Emperor's New Clothes
